flawed_nl_solution:
Tom can buy 1000/2=<<1000/2=500.0>>500.0 for half price.
He will spend $.0.5/2= $<<0.5/2=0.25>>0.25 on the half-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend 500.0*$.0.25=$125.0<<500.0*0.25=125.0>>125.0 on the half-priced bricks.
He will spend 500.0*$.0.5=$250.0<<500.0*0.5=250.0>>250.0 on the full-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend $125.0+$250.0=$379.0<<125.0+250.0=379.0>>379.0 total.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 375.0, not 379.0. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
